titleInfo.title: Kom Ombo Le Courennement de Ptolomee

mods.abstract: Wall relief of King Ptolemy XII with Deities, Temple of Sobek and Haroeris at Kom Ombo (Ptolemaic Period); Ptolemy XII, indentified by cartouches above, wears the hemhem or triple atef as he is blessed by Thoth and Isis (left) Sekhmet and two Horuses, one wearing sekhemty and one wearing the hedjet (right) rows and columns of hieroglyphs frame the scene; "63 Kom Ombo Le Courennement de Ptolemee" in pencil on back of print.

titleInfo.title: Nineteenth and Early Twentieth Century Images of Egypt

location.physicalLocation: Frank H. McClung Museum of Natural History and Culture

recordInfo.recordContentSource: Frank H. McClung Museum of Natural History and Culture
